instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message:
have a 820-2936 that had heavy liquid damage around lcd connector area. Replaced lcd connector and reflowed led driver chip. I now get a clear image but I have some black dots on the bottom of the lcd. I know its not the lcd itself since I also get the same results known good lcds.

What should I check next on board?

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: Can you post a photo? Sounds like probably spotlighting from LED_RETURN issues.

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: One of the LED return lines is open. Look at diagram and measure the 6 LED return lines on diode mode at the LCD connector, they should all 6 read the same.

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: All of the lines have the same reading except led return 1 reads 0. In this case would I just need to run a wire to R9717?

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: Just ran the wire and all 6 readings are the same now but still have the same problem

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: Bad LP8550 or bad soldering on the connector. Check LED return lines on the end of a separate LCD cable to verify the connector.

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: This can be marked as solved. Ran jumper to fix led return line I missed, all good now.

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: I'm having another issue with this board. When I start it up I just get a white screen but no ? folder ever pops up. Also wont boot from a hard drive. Is this a bios issue?

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: Try another screen to rule that out

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: You had imagen before so it is not a bios failure, missing voltage on LVDS connector.... Voltage on pin 3 and 4 from J9000?

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message:
they are both 3.10V. Screen is just white but nothing else happens. Using a known good lcd.

Also have other issue where even though battery is fully charged light will turn orange for a minute or two then green then orange e.t.c with battery plugged in

threads.title: 820-2936 black dots on lcd
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset. Measure voltage on L9004.
